The Speeches

At the conclusion of this year's meeting, Pope Francis issued a strong message against all forms of sexual abuse, particularly child sexual abuse. He reminded the participants of the role churches should play vis-à-vis governments in the fight against sexual abuse

Raising a grim scenario, President of Pax Christi International, Msgr Robert J Trautman observed, "the complicity of the church in the global sex abuse crisis is widespread, spans continents and identities, and includes leaders of the church, clergy, and religious. He demanded Pope Francis to open all archives on sex scandals and urge the future Pope to have a more "inclusive and Accountable College of Cardinals".

He further spoke of "structural and institutional impediments that stand in the way of personal, group and corporate repentance. Changing some of the key terms of the Roman Catholic Motherhouse in Rome is a bold and necessary first step in order to dismantle the imperial power structures within the Catholic Church and thus pave the way for its repentance and redemption", he said

In the same meeting, Church officials from across the globe sharply addressed the Dominican Republic authorities hunting down on abortion. The government was further urged to provide safe routes to women seeking abortion
